# Short Bio

I'm a [PhD student doing computational biology]{.my_bold} to better understand the [microbiome-gut-brain axis]{.my_bold}. I work under the supervision of Professors John F. Cryan and Gerard Clarke at APC microbiome Ireland.

Since my first year as an undergrad I have been working in the microbiome-gut-brain axis. Although I started doing molecular work, I transitioned to fully computational :computer::dna: work some years ago.

I've experience working in academia, industry, in their interface, and as a consultant.

In my daily life I like reading, hiking, drinking coffee and doing 3D design and printing.

# Research interests

My research focuses in three areas:

::: bullet-list
-   Microbiome modulation of the gut barrier integrity and its effects on host gut-brain health.
-   The gut microbiome of underrepresented population and its implications on brain health.
-   Probiotics and Psychobiotics development.
:::
